reviewText: If Boris Kodjoe is not already on the Hollywood A-list, he should be. Great actor, drop dead good looks, and enough charisma to charm even the staunchest movie critic.AS for the movie? I liked the message, but not necessarily the content. Who can argue that love and committment to family is a bad thing? The movie attempted to prove that African Americans do appreciate wholesome movies rather than the trash that is being spoonfed to their community. The female lead, played brilliantly by Ryan Michelle Bathe, is a screenwriter who with her producer husband produce a movie that gets rave reviews at film festivals but fail to secure a distributor. The screenwriter aims to change that by writing a great screenplay in very short time. That done, she is convinced that she has a great product that will sell for sure. All she needs a bankable star. Morgan Freeman comes to mind. She and her husband with their toddler in tow travel to Mississippi to find Mr. Freeman. On the way, they run into obstacles that make them question her obsession with the movie business. In the end, they do run into Mr. Freeman (or someone who looks like him).The bottom line is that the movie was never made. Why? Because is wasn't good enough? Because it wasn't bankable enough? We will never know, but that is not the important part. What is important is that love and committment to family prevailed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: How do you write a bad movie, about an experience shopping another bad movie?? I turned this off after about 30 minutes. It was sooo boring. Even the fine-ness of Boris Kodjoe could not save it.

reviewText: This movie is just as it's titled All About Us with the 2 characters throughout the entire movie; how boring!! I couldn't wait to get through this horrible low budget, bad actors/actress movie. A real waste of money in my opinion. What parents in these days leaves a small child/baby in vehicles over and over so they can spend time with each other? My heart hurt for Luke (baby) because of his self-absorbed parents that put themselves and sex above him continually. Bad movie, I would not recommend to anyone to watch this horror film!

reviewText: This movie is done similarly to documentary but, quite different. It seems the normal but, it twist. It shows people that are willing to work and see the big picture. It a true story and not the movie you expect. I really like this movie its for the family and couples to share. It gives the chance for relating as people. Its a winner. It has cameo's by two legends african american community Rube Dee and Morgan Freeman. Their roles are small but their impact is Deep! :! If you get the chance, the movie lives up to its title in that its "All About US".
